eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: The Yale Spizzwinks(?)
eventData.description: We are the world’s oldest underclassmen a cappella group. Hangout with the Spizzwinks(?) and learn more about how to get involved in a cappella!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
eventData.description:
Yale Chi Alpha is a Christian community on campus. We have weekly large group meetings we call TNL (Tuesday Night Live), weekly Core Groups, a Fall Retreat, and other fun things that happen throughout the semester. Our three core values are that students would have real devotion, real community, and real responsibility.

Meet the students within Chi Alpha! Not only will you get to meet our Core Group leaders, but some of the first years within our group will be there too as well as some of the Chi Alpha staff members. Ask any questions you want, hangout, and maybe even play some games with our students!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergrad. Science Olympiad
eventData.description:
Yale Undergraduate Science Olympiad hosts an annual Science Olympiad College Invitational for high school students, an officially recognized tournament by SOINC.

This is an informal opportunity to chat with current board members about their experiences planning and running YUSO, the community behind it, and what positions are open for incoming board members next academic year.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: VARSITY Baking Club
eventData.description:
VARSITY stands for "Vegan and Allergy-Restricted Sweets In the Tummies of Yalies" and it's mission is to 1) build community and exchange resources between individuals with food allergies and dietary restrictions and 2) facilitate the baking and eating of treats that all members can enjoy. The group is for anyone with or without dietary restrictions who enjoys food (especially dessert) and baking, but is especially conscious of making sure that we have something for everyone.

Come learn about the VARSITY Baking Club at Yale! Normally we would bake you cookies, but unfortunately all we can offer this year is a good time and good people. Stop by and learn more about extracurriculars at Yale, what it's like to have food allergies or dietary restrictions in the dining hall, or just to get a head start on planning your dessert tour of New Haven. Can't wait to meet you!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Undergrad Chapter of iCure Health
eventData.description:
Yale Undergraduate Chapter of iCure Health is part of a global non-profit that provides general education on preventive medicine as a means to combat chronic diseases, such as heart disease, diabetes, and cancer.

Are you interested in prevention of disease? Come learn more about iCure Health and the current projects we are working on! We will have trivia about prevention and other fun activities.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Christian Union Lux
eventData.description:
Christian Union Lux is a Christian fellowship and undergraduate organization at Yale University. CU Lux’s shared mission is to transform our nation and world by developing and connecting bold Christian leaders. We provide an in-depth study of Scripture, Christian leadership training, mentoring, fellowship, and support for Christian students. We also provide resources and opportunities to help any interested students — whatever their spiritual background or beliefs — learn more about Christianity. Our main activities include Bible courses, a bi-weekly lecture series called “Rooted,” retreats, and various on-campus outreaches.

Join us for The Chosen at Yale! On April 23rd, CU Lux will be interviewing Dallas Jenkins, the director of the first ever multi-season TV series about the life of Jesus and the largest crowd-funded entertainment project in history — The Chosen. Join us as we explore the global TV phenomenon that is reintroducing Jesus Christ to the 21st century. (Heads up! This will be a broad CU event— not just pre-frosh at Yale— and is a great opportunity to participate in one of our larger ministry events!) You can register here, and the link will be sent on the 23rd: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-chosen-at-yale-tickets-149635175839?keep_tld=1

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Climbing Team
eventData.description:
The Yale Climbing Team climbs weekly at a local New Haven climbing gym. Additionally, we host social events and occasionally members of the team climb outdoors!

Come join the Yale Climbing Team for a "knotty" evening! Grab a shoelace or piece of rope and learn 4 knots (1 for climbing and 3 for everyday use) to conquer the challenges of campus life!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Davenport Pops Orchestra
eventData.description:
The Davenport Pops Orchestra, affectionately known as DPops, is Yale’s only pops orchestra. DPops is entirely student run, featuring student conductors, student board, student arrangers, and student musicians.

Come meet and chat with some members of DPops! Just drop by anytime during the hour to ask questions and learn more about DPops (this isn't a super formal event). We're really excited to meet with you and answer any questions you have about the orchestra :D

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
eventData.description:
The Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing (YuQC) group is a network of peers working to better understand and leverage principles of Quantum Computation. Yale has notably driven innovation at the frontiers of quantum information science for the past few decades. Our student organization was thus formed out of a necessity to bridge the gap between Yale’s vibrant graduate research community in quantum engineering and the potential quantum scientists in its undergraduate student body.

YuQC is fundamentally an organization that brings together students in the pursuit of knowledge and interdisciplinary innovation. To accomplish the breadth of our goals, we are thus committed to fostering an inclusive environment that best supports the diversity of our talented membership.

Come join our Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing Group Social. Learn more at yaleqc.com and qchack.io.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Russian Chorus
eventData.description:
The Yale Russian Chorus (YRC) is a tenor-bass a cappella choral ensemble specializing in sacred and secular Slavic choral music. Chorus members are Yale University students from a variety of academic disciplines. Founded in 1953 by Denis Mickiewicz, a Yale student at the time, the YRC is recognized as one of the world’s premier performance ensembles of Slavic music today.

Hang out with a few chorus members, learn about the group, talk about Russian things, and watch our favorite Russian meme videos. Who is Masha, who is The Bear, and why are they so popular?! ???? ????????!
